question: [File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Integer Overflow] Can max_signatures_per_txn be set to u16::MAX (65535) allowing an attacker to submit transactions with excessive authenticators that cause memory exhaustion or validator node crashes during validation loops? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Integer Overflow] Can max_exp_horizon_secs be set to u64::MAX allowing keyless signatures to be valid indefinitely, breaking expiration security guarantees and enabling replay attacks over arbitrarily long time periods? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [DoS Attack] Can max_commited_epk_bytes be set to 0, causing all keyless transactions to fail validation and resulting in complete denial of service for keyless accounts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [DoS Attack] Can max_iss_val_bytes be set to 0, blocking all keyless authentication by rejecting valid JWT issuer values and causing permanent account lockout? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [DoS Attack] Can max_extra_field_bytes be set to 0, preventing legitimate keyless accounts from authenticating when extra JWT fields are required for their identity provider? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [DoS Attack] Can max_jwt_header_b64_bytes be set to 0, causing all JWT header parsing to fail and breaking keyless authentication system-wide? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [State Inconsistency] Can max_signatures_per_txn overflow when cast to usize on 32-bit systems, causing different validation behavior between 32-bit and 64-bit validators and leading to consensus failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [State Inconsistency] Can max_commited_epk_bytes exceed circuit_constants::MAX_COMMITED_EPK_BYTES, creating mismatch between on-chain config and ZK circuit constraints causing proof verification failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [State Inconsistency] Can max_iss_val_bytes exceed circuit_constants::MAX_ISS_VAL_BYTES, allowing on-chain config to accept JWT issuer values larger than the circuit can handle, breaking proof generation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [State Inconsistency] Can max_extra_field_bytes exceed circuit_constants::MAX_EXTRA_FIELD_BYTES, creating inconsistency between Move config and circuit constraints leading to unverifiable proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [State Inconsistency] Can max_jwt_header_b64_bytes exceed circuit_constants::MAX_JWT_HEADER_B64_BYTES, allowing headers larger than circuit capacity causing proof verification to always fail? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Resource Exhaustion] Can override_aud_vals vector grow unbounded through repeated governance updates, causing memory exhaustion during deserialization and crashing validator nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Resource Exhaustion] Can override_aud_vals contain extremely long strings (e.g., 10MB each), causing excessive memory allocation during validation and enabling memory-based DoS attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Validation Bypass] Can override_aud_vals contain empty strings, allowing attackers to use empty aud values to bypass audience validation checks in JWT claims? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Validation Bypass] Can override_aud_vals contain duplicate entries, causing is_allowed_override_aud() to count duplicates incorrectly and produce inconsistent validation results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Validation Bypass] Can override_aud_vals contain unicode normalization variants (e.g., 'aud' vs 'aud'), allowing attackers to bypass allowlist checks through normalization attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Cryptographic Weakness] Can training_wheels_pubkey be set to an invalid Ed25519 public key that passes Some() check but fails during deserialization, causing inconsistent validation behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Cryptographic Weakness] Can training_wheels_pubkey be set to None during active use, causing in-flight transactions with training wheels signatures to suddenly fail validation after configuration change? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Cryptographic Weakness] Can training_wheels_pubkey contain malformed bytes (wrong length, all zeros, all ones) that pass vector validation but cause Ed25519PublicKey deserialization to panic? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Type Confusion] Can training_wheels_pubkey contain bytes that decode as valid Ed25519 key but represent a weak key (all zeros, small order point), breaking training wheels security model? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Function: new_for_devnet()] [Security Misconfiguration] Does new_for_devnet() include OVERRIDE_AUD_FOR_TESTING in override_aud_vals, and can this test audience value remain enabled in production allowing attackers to forge keyless accounts? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Function: new_for_devnet()] [Security Misconfiguration] Can new_for_devnet() be accidentally called in production environments, enabling test configuration values (max_signatures_per_txn=3, weak exp_horizon) that weaken security guarantees? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Function: new_for_devnet()] [Security Misconfiguration] Does max_exp_horizon_secs=10_000_000 (~115 days) in new_for_devnet() allow excessively long-lived keyless signatures that can be replayed months after compromise? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Function: new_for_devnet()] [Security Misconfiguration] Does max_signatures_per_txn=3 in new_for_devnet() limit transaction complexity preventing legitimate multi-sig use cases or is this insufficient to prevent batch validation DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/keyless/configuration.rs] [Function: new_for_devnet()] [State Inconsistency] Does new_for_devnet() initialize circuit constant fields (max_commited_epk_bytes, max_iss_val_bytes, etc.) from circuit_constants module, and can these values become stale if circuit is updated without config sync? (High)
